properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:35PM CST until January 14 at 2:34PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
...From the National Weather Service in Little Rock...the Flood
Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas...

Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County


River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall
forecasted to occur over the next 48 hours. During periods of
flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall
forecasts.

Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our
Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at...
www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Fourche Lafave River Near Houston.
* from Sunday morning to Tuesday afternoon...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At  6:30 PM Friday the stage was 11.9 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late Sunday morning and
continue to rise to near 25.5 feet by just after midnight Monday
morning. The river will fall below flood stage by late Monday morning.
* Impacts at 25.0 feet...Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River
and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and
livestock should be moved to higher ground.


Fld     Observed        Forecast 6 AM        Crest
Location     Stg   Stg  Day Time   Sat   Sun   Mon  Crest Time  Date

Fourche Lafave River
Houston     25  11.9 Fri 06 PM  14.1  24.7  25.3   25.5 12 AM 01/13
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Remember to Turn Around...Don't Drown
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.

Everyone with property or other interest along streams and rivers
should remain alert to changing weather forecasts. Should conditions
change...Look for river forecasts or Flood Warnings for use in making
informed decisions to protect life and property.
